title: [Large-Scale] Impact of Attention Types and Short-Term Memory on Recall Performance in Multimedia Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of fundamental mathematical concepts and experience using digital devices
context.additional_context: A math education program for working professionals centered on formative assessments using smartphone-based VR simulation tools

learning_goals: Learners can explain the differences between focused and divided attention types in multimedia environments
Learners can analyze the impact of working memory capacity on learning outcomes and design personalized learning strategies
Learners can apply optimal attention resource allocation methods in mathematical problem-solving through VR-based simulations with over 80% accuracy

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
